  • Constructor Details

    • UserService

      @Autowired public UserService(UserRepository userRepository, org.springframework.security.crypto.password.PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder, JwtTokenProvider jwtTokenProvider)
      Constructor for the UserService. We use constructor injection here. It's a fancy way of saying "Spring, please give me the tools I need to do my job".
      Parameters:
      userRepository - The repository to talk to the 'users' table.
      passwordEncoder - The tool to encrypt and check passwords.

  • Method Details

    • loadUserByUsername

      public org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails loadUserByUsername(String username) throws org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException
      This is the main method that Spring Security will call. When a user tries to log in, Spring will ask this method: "Hey, can you find me a user with this username?".
      Specified by:
      loadUserByUsername in interface org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetailsService
      Parameters:
      username - The username the user is trying to log in with.
      Returns:
      A UserDetails object (our own User class) that Spring can use.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException - if we can't find the user in our database.

    • createUser

      public LoginResponse createUser(User user)
      Creates a new user. It checks for duplicates and encrypts the password before saving.
      Parameters:
      user - The user object with the plain-text password.
      Returns:
      The saved user with the encrypted password.

    • getAllUsers

      public List<User> getAllUsers()
